alert.note: Alert for Luzerne; Wyoming (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Binghamton (South Central New York and Northeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 17 at 4:53AM EST until January 17 at 5:00PM EST by NWS Binghamton
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 PM EST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Mixed precipitation and blowing snow expected. Additional snow accumulations of 1 to 4 inches and ice accumulations of a light glaze. Winds gusting as high as 30 mph, with a few gusts over 40 mph above 1500 feet elevation. * WHERE...Luzerne and Wyoming counties. * WHEN...Until 5 PM EST Monday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning commute. Gusty winds could bring down tree branches. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Precipitation has become spotty across the area this morning, but where it is falling, precipitation types range from rain to snow, with spotty freezing drizzle possible in the Poconos. Cooler air should change precip back to all snow later this morning, but coverage will showery. Blowing and drifting snow will be the more critical hazard through the morning commute.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions for Pennsylvania can be found at 511pa.com, or by dialing 5 1 1 from within the state.
